Introduction

The Release package consists of MCAL Drivers & Demos/Applications for AM62x/AM62Ax devices . The MCAL modules are compliant to AUTOSAR specification versioned 4.3.1. This is a intermediate release for AM62x/AM62Ax MCAL (validated on AM62x, AM62Ax and AM62Q).

Licensing

Refer to MCAL_SitaraMPU_02.01.00_manifest at top level [HTML]

Getting Started

The AM62x[HTML]/AM62Ax [HTML] User Guide provides the documentation and references necessary to begin development on TI's platforms using AM62x/AM62Ax.

Documentation

Refer to following documentation for further details:

AM62x/AM62Q User Guide This document details Supported driver, Installation, Dependencies, Build instructions, Steps to run example applications, Module Specific User Guides and others [HTML]
AM62Ax User Guide This document details Supported driver, Installation, Dependencies, Build instructions, Steps to run example applications, Module Specific User Guides and others [HTML]
MCAL Configurator User Guide Refer this before attempting to reconfigure MCAL modules. This include steps to Install Configurator (EB), Configurator Licensing, Generation of MCAL Configurations and others [HTML]

What's New

New features supported in this release:

  • Supported SoC: AM62x.
  • MCAL Drivers: MCU, CAN, GPT, DIO, WDG, IPC-CDD, SPI, FLS(OSPI NOR), ETH, ETHTRCV
  • Supported SoC: AM62Ax.
  • MCAL Drivers: MCU, CAN, GPT, DIO, WDG, IPC-CDD, SPI, ETH, ETHTRCV
  • Validated MCAL modules
    • On AM62x SPI Main Domain (MCSPI0, MCSPI1, MCSPI2) support added. Basic Validation Completed.
    • On AM62x DIO Main Domain (GPIO0, GPIO1) support added. Basic Validation Completed.
    • MCALs validated on AM62Q HS-FS ,AM62x GP, AM62AX HS-FS EVM's.
  • ETH Driver: Interrupt Pacing Support

Upgrade and Compatibility Information

  • Feature NOT supported
    • FLS driver not support the post-build configuration.
    • FLS driver not supported on AM62Q/AM62Ax EVMs as only OSPI NOR supported.

    Device Support

    SoC HOST (OS) Test Platform
    AM62x/AM62Q/AM62Ax Windows / Linux, EB configurator only on Windows AM62x/AM62Q/AM62Ax EVM

    Validation Information

    The MCAL drivers are using following tools. The MCAL examples are built and validated on mcu_plus_sdk_08_06_00_18 version.

    Build Tools :

    • Clang compiler: 1.3.0
    • EB Tresos: 24.0.0
    • gmake
    • Code Composer Studio: 12.1.0

    Dependencies:

    • Refer to respective version of MCU+SDK User Guide to setup the EVM.

    Fixed Issues

    ID Issue Summary
    MCAL-9119 AM62x: SPI Plugin Configuration is implemented and tested with Pre, Post and link time config
    MCAL-9120 AM62Ax: SPI Plugin Configuration is implemented and tested with Pre, Post and link time config
    MCAL-9618 AM62x/AM62Ax: IPC CDD::Switch to use the ISR Macro for compatibility with any OS
    MCAL-9000 AM62x/AM62Ax: Non EB xdm are supported for SPI and DIO.
    MCAL-8922 AM62Ax: Testing on MCAN1 is validated for both Polling and Interrupt Mode.
    MCAL-9798 AM62x: SPI Main Domain: Polling mode validation only. Interrupt mode Validation Pending.

    Known Issues

    ID Variant Severity Summary Comments
    MCAL-9284 AM62x S3-Minor AM62x: FLS : Facing DET error during FLS interrupt mode write operation, Along with this the features 1)PHY mode, 2) Interrupt Mode and 3. XIP mode is not supporting. FLS Driver improvements and feature completion will be part of Safety Release.
    MCAL-10031 AM62Ax S3-Major AM62AX: SPI FT is hung up in MCU_MCSPI0 TX to RX Multi Channel, One Job, One Sequence Loopback Synctransmit IB Test (testcase 102) in release mode Facing this issue due to code optimization. Working on to fix in the next Release
    MCAL-10425 AM62Ax S3-Major AM62Ax: IPC-CDD: Validation of DM R5 is In progress Suspecting incorrect configuration and it is under debug. Drivers and plugins should support DM R5 communication as well.

    Known Limitations or Open Points

    ID Description Workaround Comments
    MCAL-9286 AM62x: CAN: MCU_MCAN0 and MCU_MCAN1 Does Not Support Interrupt Mode. Only Main MCAN0 Shall Support Interrupt Polling mode should be used. Hardware Limitation and only Main MCAN0 Shall Support Interrupt
    NA AM62x: SPI and DIO Main Domain Support is validated only on AM62x. No changes expected between AM62x and AM62Q AM62Q will be validated in next release.
    NA AM62x: SPI and DIO Main domain support - Basic validation along with 70% Unit test complete. NA Remaining Unit Test is on going.
    MCAL-8987 AM62x/AM62Ax:CDD IPC : 50% Unit Test Coverage is completed NA Remaining Unit Test is on going.
    NA AM62x/AM62Ax: ETH : Ethernet Driver has SDK dependency for SciClient NA NA

    Technical Support

    For technical support and additional assistance, visit [E2E] or contact local TI Field Application Engineer. [HTML]

    Package Versioning

    Each package version is composed of 4 period-delimited numbers - represented here by the letters M, m, p and b [M.m.p.b]. . The table below provides a descriptive reference regarding package version numbering.

    Digit Meaning Description
    1 (M=Major) Major revision Incremented when the new version is substantially different from the previous For example, a new module added or an existing module's algorithm significantly altered.
    2 (m=minor) Minor revision Incremented when the new version has changed but not in a major way. For example, some minor changes in the API or feature set.
    3 (p=patch) Patch number Incremented for all other source code changes. This include any packaging support code.
    4 (b=build) Build number Incremented for each release delivery to CM. Reset for any change to M, m or p
